Patience will use this loan to buy more goods for business expansion. She hopes to use the profits to re-invest into the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for business expansion.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa O. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one girl and one boy who are both in the primary school at the moment. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Theresa’s husband is a farmer while she is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods – sets of utensils from Kumasi – at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well.

Theresa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk

loans.name: Okuezuru

texts.en: N. bakes chin chin (cookies), meat pies, fish rolls, and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. N. is 35 years old and married to Mr. Okuezuru. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell and ingredients such as flour to use in preparing her baked goods. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell and ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Cette dame vit en famille avec son époux qui est un cuisinier et ses 03 enfants, pour aider son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer, elle a commencé en 2000 le commerce de  charbons de bois, de tubercules et de céréales. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, ce qui lui permet de toucher un plus grand nombre de clients. Son stock de marchandises ayant connu une baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois, 5 sacs de maïs, 03 sacs d’haricot et 10 tas d’ignames.
texts.en:
This woman lives with her family: her husband, a cook, and her three children. To help her husband with day-to-day household expenses, she started doing commerce in charcoal in 2000. She operates door-to-door, which allows her to reach a larger number of customers. Since her stock of merchandise has experience a drop, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, 5 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of beans, and 10 piles of yams.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, grains, and yams

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace A. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. For the past five years, this hard-working lady has operated both a retail shop and a tailoring business.  This is her first loan request with the group, and she plans to use the money to purchase additional products for her shop and increase the quantities of the products that she currently carries to ensure that profits increase. As well, she wants to increase the stock of clothes for her tailoring business, hoping to thereby double her profits.  She is grateful for the help rendered to the group.

loans.use: Restocking both her retail and tailoring businesses.

loans.name: Iris Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Iris es una socia muy dinámica.  Tiene 47 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de joyas.  Su esposo es chofer de motocarro.  Iris pertenece hace 3 años al Banco Comunal 
“ Señor de Luren”, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles , el cual la ayudó a invertir  en productos de belleza.
Con este préstamo de 1,500 soles, piensa invertirlo en joyas, ella ofrece sus joyas en los mercados de la zona y cobra diariamente (a manero de crédito), su negocio ha prosperado ya que ahora tiene 4 vendedoras a su cargo.
 
La meta de iris es tener su propio local  para dedicarse a  la venta de  joyas y  adornos para el hogar..

loans.use: comprar joyas y venderlas

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan vive en la calle  “Gaceta del Sur” de la zona  Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia, actualmente se encuentra divorciado de su esposa con la cual tiene una pequeña hija. 

Trabaja como tramitador en un estudio jurídico, en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materiales de construcción (arena , cemento, ladrillo y fierro) para su  vivienda, la cual se encuentra en etapa de construcción.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Hernan lives on Southern Gazette Street in the Villa Exaltation zone of the city of El Alto. He lives in his own house, and is presently divorced from his wife with whom he has a small daughter. He works as a clerk in a law school in the city of La Paz.

His loan is for the purchase of construction materials (sand, cement, bricks, and reinforcement rods) for his house, which is still under construction. This is his first loan with IMPRO. Their completed evaluation found him qualified to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO CONTINUE BUILDING HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally R. is from the village of Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Sally is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sally joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sally is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Sally from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Yanet

texts.es: Maria Yanet es una señora que está casada, tiene dos hijos que cuentan con 3 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, la familia vive en una casa que es propia y que se encuentra en la comunidad. Maria Yanet  se dedica al negocio de la venta de comidas y refrescos, tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio, el nivel de competitividad en el rubro es de nivel medio por la zona. El destino del crédito fue para incrementar dinero para la adquisición de una vagoneta, misma que le permitirá desplazarse de mejor manera. Maria Yanet tiene un buen historial crediticio en nuestra Institución, todo el tiempo de la relación comercial demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria Yanet is married and has two children; they are three and seven years old. The family lives in their own house, which is in the community. Maria Yanet sells food and soft drinks. She has a lot of experience in the business. The level of competition in the field is medium. The loan is to buy a small wagon, which will allow her to travel in a better way. Maria Yanet has a good credit history with our Institution. During the entire time of our commercial relationship she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a small wagon

loans.name: Maria Licet

texts.es: La señora Maria Licet tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 2. La señora Maria  se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 4 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de domestica, por lo que sus ingresos eran muy pocos y necesita mucho más para sufragar los gastos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de ropa ya que en este momento aprovecha a comprar porque se acerca la temporada navideña y todos estos productos suben de precio. Su sueño es llegar a instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Licet is 44 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She has been selling clothing for 4 years. Previously she offered housekeeping services, but her earnings were not enough to cover her expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase clothing for the holiday season before prices increase. Maria dreams of opening a distribution center where she lives since none exists at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Helena M. from Mbozi, married with two children aged three and seven. Helena has been running a medical store since 2004, working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and assisted by one employee. Helena currently earns about $120USD per month from her business, and she is requesting a loan in order to purchase medicines in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve both the quality and range of her products. Helena thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in bulk

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en: Tsengel J. is a 21-year-old woman who lives with her parents and two youngest siblings in Bayanhongor Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She graduated her high school in 2005. After her high school graduation, she decided to learn how to haircut. She took a training course in haircutting and interned at the local barbershop for a year. She launched her barbershop in 2007 by renting a small space in a local barbershop. As she became recognized by local customers, she decided to move on by herself and opened her own barbershop. She now rents some commercial space and runs her haircutting business. She says that she enjoys running her business and would like to see herself as well as her business to grow fast. She requests a loan to purchase haircutting equipment. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase haircutting equipment.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel F. Méndez y su hermano Gabriel tienen un negocio de Abarrotes y servicio de Computadoras con Internet este negocio es llamado “Abarrotes Marely”  ya tiene 7 meses que empezó y en el cual han observado que les esta funcionando muy bien, es por ello que quieren comprar 2 computadoras mas ya que los clientes hay veces que no alcanzan computadora y ellos desean dar un mejor servicio al cliente. Para poder realzar su proyecto ellos necesitan capital para hacer esta compra y así obtener mas ingresos en esta época del año.
texts.en:
Ángel F. Méndez and his brother Gabriel have a grocery store business where they also sell internet access. This store is called "Abarrotes Marely." They started this business 7 months ago and they have observed that it is working very well. For this reason they want to buy 2 more computers, since the customers at times cannot get on a computer, and they want to provide better service for their customers. In order to carry out this project they need capital to make the purchase, and in this way obtain higher earnings during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 computers for their business

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku F. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages and beer. She is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer and more materials to use in making the local beer.  

Kaku is 25 years old and married to a farmer. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of beer and more materials to use in making the local beer

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose David tiene un año de laborar como tecnico operador de la Alcaldia del Coral, recientemente acaba de contraer matriminio, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar a pesar que no tienen hijos ellos siempre estan al pendiente de sus padres, este  crédito lo requiere para  invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construir los servicios Higienicos), se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, servicial, honesto y muy trabajador es un hombre con alto espiritud de superación personal y laboral, que ama su trabajo, su sueño es tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita.
texts.en:
Jose David has been working for a year as a technical operator for the city of El Coral. He recently got married and his wife is in charge of the household chores. Even though they do not have children, they have always been inclined to become parents. This loan will be used to pay for a home improvement (construction of a lavatory). Jose David is known as a responsible, helpful, honest, and hardworking man who is always in high spirits and looks to improve personally and professionally. He enjoys his work and dreams of having stability, health, and a beautiful home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a lavatory

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh F. est un professeur d’éducation sportive dans un collège de Thiès ville située à 70 Kms de Dakar.  Il a embrassé ce métier depuis 1979 et  depuis 3 ans il s’est investi dans l’aviculture grâce à l’influence d’un ami. Il vit avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants dans sa maison qui est toujours en travaux. C’est une maison qu’il a bâti par le concours de ses nombreux prêts octroyés au niveau de la mutuelle de l’U-IMCEC où il est membre depuis l’ouverture. Il a contracté 13 crédits qu’il a soldés sans problèmes. Ainsi pour les finitions de son batiment, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA  qu’il espère payer avant la date d’échéance.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh F. is a sports instructor in a secondary school of Thiès, a town located 70 kilometers from Dakar. He has embraced this profession since 1979, and for the past three years has invested in aviculture following the advice of a friend. He lives with his wife and five children in a house that is still under construction. It is a house built thanks to repeated loans from U-IMCEC, where he has been a member since its conception. He was granted thirteen loans, all reimbursed without problems. To finish his house, he is requesting a loan for 150,000 FCFA he hopes to pay off before the due date.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building home

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es:
La señora A. Gómez trabaja como vendedora ambulante de cosméticos en el municipio de somotillo nos esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de cemento para repellar su casa de habitación y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella ha tenido 2 créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los cancelo antes de la fecha estipulada de cancelación.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. Gómez works as a door-to-door cosmetics salesperson in Somotillo. She is asking for funding to buy cement to plaster her house thereby improving her living conditions. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL which she repaid ahead of time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement to plaster the house and paint to paint it.

loans.name: Las Bendecidas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Bendecidas” esta representado por la señora Amparo y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales van cursando un segundo ciclo demostrando unidad, responsabilidad y ganas de seguir ¡creciendo para salir adelante y progresar mas cada día. La señora amparo C. P. (presidenta) tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos y gracias a su esfuerzo ella sigue adelante en su trabajo día a día, ella tiene 2 hijos y separada de su esposo por lo que sabe sobrellevar las cosas para sacar adelante a sus hijos, es una mujer trabajadora y a demostrado ser muy responsable, ella vive en anticrítico, y sueña con tener su propio hogar donde pueda vivir ella y sus dos hijos, por ello la señora Amparo se esta esforzando mucho para poder llegar a su sueño, el destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio. En este grupo todos son multifacéticos, les gusta trabajar mucho, tienen venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de pollos, venta de refrescos y empanadas, venta de leche, venta de verduras, venta de majablanco y otros. En este caso no hay competencia porque todos tienen diferentes negocios y todos les va muy bien porque salen a distintos puntos de venta tanto en la ciudad como en las afueras de ella para poder vender su mercadería. El destino del crédito es  para poder incrementar sus insumos, mercaderías y productos para poder obtener mejores ingresos y para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Las socias ya tiene bastante experiencia con respecto a lo que es créditos solidarios, es un grupo antiguo, y muy bueno, termino muy bien en su primer crédito con nosotros y hasta la fecha siguen demostrando ser gente muy trabajadora y responsable por lo que la Institución les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que puedan progresar y darles a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.
texts.en:
The “Las Bendecidas” (The Blessed Ones) is represented by Amparo and made up of 14 members who are in their second loan cycle. They have shown unity, responsibility and the desire to continue growing to get ahead and make more progress every day. Amparo C. P. (group president) has a cosmetics sales business. Thanks to her efforts, she continues to move forward in her work day to day. She has two children and is separated from her husband. Because of this, she overcomes obstacles in order to get her children ahead in life. She’s a hard-working woman and has shown herself to be very responsible. She lives under the anticretico modality (a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) and dreams with having her own home for her and her two children. Amparo is making a great effort to reach this goal. She will use the funds as working capital to continue growing in her business. All the members of this group are multifaceted; they enjoy work very much. Some sell food; others sell groceries, chickens, soft-drinks and turnovers. Some sell milk, others vegetables. Some sell maja blanco (a sweet). In this case, competition is non-existent because they all have different businesses and they all do well because they go out to different points of sale both within the city and to its outskirts in order to sell their merchandise. The funds will be used to increase their ingredients, supplies and products in order to generate better income and meet customer demand. The members already have quite a bit of experience in the field of group loans. This is an established, very good group. They completed their first loan cycle well with us and, to date, continue to prove themselves as being very hard-working and responsible people. The institution, therefore, grants new economic support to them so that they may continue to succeed and provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Pedro Alonso

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alonso R. C. es originario de la comunidad él coyol municipio de condega departamento de Estelí cuenta con una extensión de diez manzanas de terreno entre ellas tres de café  además se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como el frijol y maíz se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de abono y alambre el cual le dará mantenimiento a su finca.
Su negocio de café comenzó  con la ayuda de organismos y el apoyo de su papá ya que él se dedicaba también a este tipo de rubro hoy en día don Pedro  lleva un buen manejo de su cultivo y cultiva granos básicos que es una de las principales actividades de la región antes de dedicarse a esta actividad el trabajaba ayudándole a su papá en el negocio del ganado.

El espera que con el crédito que se le otorgo le ayude a mejorar su finca ya que necesitaba invertir para la cosecha del próximo año para obtener un buen rendimiento.


Pedro Alonso es casado y tiene seis hijos pero solo dos están bajo su cargo en edad escolar el cual uno esta en secundaria y el otro en primaria.
Este es el tercer crédito que don Pedro tiene con ceprodel y trabaja desde el dos mil uno con la institución y expresa que sus créditos con ceprodel la han ayudado de mucho ya que a mejorado su finca y el nivel familiar
texts.en:
Pedro Alonso R. C. is from El Coyol, Condega, Estelí department. He has a 10-manzana (1 manzana = 1.73 acres) spread on three of which he grows coffee; he also farms basic grains like beans and corn. He was granted a loan to buy manure and wire fencing for farm maintenance. He started his coffee growing business with help from his father and organizations; his father was in the same line of work. Today, Pedro manages his crops well and farms basic grains, which is one of the main activities in this region. Prior to this, he used to help his father raise cattle. He hopes that this loan will allow him to make some improvements to his farm because he needs to invest in next year’s harvest in order to get good yields. Pedro Alonso is married and has six children only two of whom, one in secondary school and one in elementary school, are still school-aged and under his care. This is Pedro’s third loan with Ceprodel; he has been collaborating with the institution since 2001. He states that Ceprodel loans have helped him a great deal in that he has improved both his farm and his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Upendo Kahembe Group

texts.fr:
Masika T. est présidente du groupe de crédit Upendo Kahembe, elle lève la main sur la photo , cliente au 13e  cycle de credit,agée de 41 ans, divorcée.Elle est mère de  7 enfants  parmi lesquels   4   vont à l’école et 1 fait une formation en mécanique,  2 autres n’ont pas l’âge scolaire  .Notons  qu’elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants car son ancien mari l’a complètement abandonné.
Son business est la fabrication artisanale de boisson traditionnelle appelée “Mandrakwa” issue de transformation de Maïs par une technologie locale.
Elle a commencé ses activités avec un capital propre de 60$  après l’érruption du volcan nyiragongo qui avait complètement detruit  toutes les économies de la ville de Goma en janvier 2002.
il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de fabrication artisanale de boisson traditionnelle “Madrakwa”.  
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant   32 sacs de Maïs et renforcer ses equipements de production.
En outre, elle planifie ouvrir une petite boutique et acheter un minu bus pour le transport urbain étant donné que son fils aine vient de terminer une formation en mécanique auto mobile.
Elle rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle recoit sans aucune garantie materielle car grace a ces credits elle parvient a subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et se realiser progressivement des economies familiales.
Ce groupe est  composé des 12 membres dont 11 femmes et 1 homme sur la photo.
texts.en:
Masika T., who puts up her hand on the picture, chairs the credit group Upendo Kahembe. She is currently on her 13th loan cycle. She is 41 years old, divorced and the mother of seven children: four of them attend school, one is trained as a mechanic and two are too young to go to school. It is worth noting that she provides only for her children, because her ex-husband has completely left her. Masika's business consists of small-scale production of the traditional drink "Mandrakwa", which is made from corn with local technology. She began this activity with a start capital of US$60, just after the eruption of Nyiragongo Volcano in January 2002 had destroyed the whole economic infrastructure in the city of Goma. Thus she produced for 8 years "Mandrakwa" in her traditional production style. She came to the microfinance institution Hekima and applied for this loan, which she will use to buy 32 sacks of corn to bolster her production capacity and increase her turnover. In addition, she wants to open a small store and buy a minibus for city transportation, since her oldest son has just finished his apprenticeship in automobile mechanics. Masika is thankful to MFI Hekima for the loans granted to her without any physical guarantee, because these loans enabled her to provide for her children and gradually build up some savings for her family. This group is composed of 12 members, 11 women and 1 man, all pictured.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 32 sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion M. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 60 years old. Encarnacion is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Encarnacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Encarnacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Encarnacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Encarnacion successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. Encarnacion is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Encarnacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de poisson frais, de condiments et de l’arachide.
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                     MARIAM D. du groupe Tièssiri compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des poissons frais.
Elle s’approvisionne en poissons le plus généralement à Dioïla et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women in the Tièssiri group are all around 45 years old and are married with three children on average; they all live in traditional large households in Fatiana village, the sub-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second largest region in the Republic of Mali). They met through their children and sell fresh fish, condiments and peanuts for a living. They are seeking their first loan, which group member Mariam D. will use in order to buy fresh fish. She generally sources the fish at Dioïla and the surrounding villages, and sells her wares from her stall at the Dioïla market, as well as in the neighbouring markets. She takes cash or credit sales from a customer base made up of both men and women. She envisages generating an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which would be used to see to her family's day-to-day needs, with leftover funds being invested back into the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fish

loans.name: Mpapai Group

texts.en:
Meet Abdul K. and the Mpapai Group!  Abdul is 41 years old and married.  He has five children between the ages of 3 and 16 years old.  His oldest four children go to school.  Abdul also supports his 20-year-old sister-in-law, who lives with the family.  Abdul started selling used clothing about ten years ago, and with the help of past loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, he now focuses on selling second-hand shoes.  Abdul has repaid all of his loans, and his business is going well.  He earns a profit of about US$ 150 per month.  

With this loan, Abdul plans to buy about 50 pairs of second-hand shoes for his shop.  He will select men's and women's shoes, sandals and boots.  With the profits, Abdul will continue to support his family and pay for food and school fees.  He hopes to reinvest additional savings into his business, and eventually open up a second location in the busy Kariako market of Dar Es Salaam. 

Abdul is the chairman of the Mpapai group.  The group's 17 members run a variety of businesses including salons, shops, tailoring, and charcoal sales.  The group's members will hold each other accountable for repaying this loan.  

In the photo, Abdul is standing 3rd from the right, wearing a white shirt.  All of the group members are pictured, however, Rehema A. is hidden at the back.  Zambda S. is covered in the front.  She wanted to be in the photo, but didn't want to show her face.

loans.use: increasing stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther L. is currently in the business of selling fresh and dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell.  Esther is 24 years-old and unmarried.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Ciudad de Dios, una comunidad pequeña perteneciente al distrito de Guadalupe, provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de comida y refrigerios dentro de dos instituciones educativas de la zona en donde vive, por las mañanas ofrece su mercadería en un colegio primario y en las tardes hace la misma labor en un colegio secundario, generalmente ofrece platos de comida y golosinas durante el recreo de los estudiantes, ella elabora esos platos con mucha responsabilidad, ya que sus principales clientes son menores de edad.

El negocio goza de buena acogida y cada vez está creciendo mas, por ello ha creído conveniente ampliarlo con la compra de mas insumos con los cuales pueda preparar mas platos de comida y ampliar sus ventas, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juana es una mujer responsable y honesta. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her family in the Ciudad de Dios sector. It is a small community, which belongs to the Guadalupe district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region. It is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells food and refreshments in two educational institutions in the area where she lives. In the morning she sells her merchandise in an elementary school. In the afternoons she does the same work at a high school. She generally sells dishes of food and sweets during the students’ recess. She makes these dishes with great care because her main customers are minors. The business is well received, and it is growing. That is why she believes that it is fitting to expand it with the purchase of more supplies. Then she could prepare more dishes and increase her sales in order to achieve her goal. She believes that is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles, which will help her meet her objective. Juan is a responsible and honest woman. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase her business of selling food in schools

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - Guadalupe - Pacasmayo - La Libert

loans.name: Ricardo Elias

texts.es:
Ricardo de 35 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales),  el tiene un taller mecánico desde hace años. 

Cuando comenzó con su taller fue con la motivación de mantener a su familia, el tenia su taller en la calle pero con los bueno ingresos que obtuvo pudo readecuar su casa y ubicar el taller de mecánica, ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 17h00pm le ayudan dos personas. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar herramientas y repuestos para su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio en otro lugar y readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 35 years old, and lives in the Guyaquil suburb (an urban area, the majority of the people are in the informal business) he has a mechanics’ shop for some two years.

When he began his workshop it was with the incentive to support his family, he had his workshop in the street but with good earnings he was able to refit his home and locate the mechanic’s shop, he now works from 08h30am until 17h00pm he is helped by two people.

With the loan he wants to buy tools and spare parts for his business, in the future he wants to expand his business in another place and to remodel his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Martha Elizabet

texts.es: Doña Martha Elizabeth Vásquez A. de 41 años es una mujer luchadora y esmerada, costurera que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, en especial de huipiles en el mercado municipal de Masaya y en su casa de habitación. Su fuente de inspiración son sus tres hijos por quienes trabaja y se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante. Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de materiales para seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth Vasquez A., 41, is a woman who strives to succeed and puts a lot of care into her work. She is a dressmaker who for 10 years has been selling clothing, especially huipiles (traditional Mayan woven garments), in the municipal market of Masaya and also from her house. Her 3 children are her source of inspiration; she works hard for them every day to get ahead. She will use the loan to buy materials to continue increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for her clothing business

loans.name: Bettsy

texts.es: Bettsy, de 24 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Franklin de 30 años y su querido hijo, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Bettsy ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de La Merced, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo  comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, hará limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Bettsy is 24 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband, Franklin, 30 years old, and their beloved son. She wishes to provide them with a better quality of life. She a great deal of effort Bettsy has managed to work the fields and make them very productive. She cultivates coffee and bananas, products that she later sells in wholesale at the La Merced market. What she likes most about her work is caring for her fields. She has been working at this business for the past 4 years. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport the products all the way to La Merced market. The sacks are very heavy and it makes her very tired. In time she hopes to purchase more land to expand her plantations. This is the third loan she requests from MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been very punctual with her payments in the past and she hopes to keep up her record. She is a very involved member of her community bank, always aware of the business agreements of the group. With the two thousand nuevos soles she requests she will clear her field and hire the help that she needs to care of the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire the help that she needs to work the plantations.

loans.name: Abraham Kipleting

texts.en:
Abraham Kipleting T. is a 31-year-old businessman who operates a dairy business, selling his product to his customers to earn a profit. He is married to Rhoda Jelimo T., who is 22 years old, and they have two children age five years and two years. He runs his business in Kapseret, 10km from Eldoret town and has been in this business for the past three years.

Abraham was introduced to KADET by one of its credit officers and he has no other history with any micro-financial institution. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000 with KADET which he plans to use to purchase two dairy cows.

Abraham hopes to operate a large-scale dairy farm, whereby he will be able to supply milk to hotels (restaurants), sell the best quality milk to his customers and, in the future, extend the same services to companies like KCC, Brookside.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Mayli Cecilia

texts.es:
Mayli cecilia T.
Ella se dedica junto al lado de su esposo a la confección de  camisas en diferentes tallas y colores.  Iniciaron su propio negocio desde hace dos años y a Dios gracias tiene demanda de su producto, con lo que ella ve que sus  ventas son buenas.  Para poder atender la demanda de los clientes necesita más capital por lo que hacen una solicitud de crédito.  Tiene un hijo varón de un año y desea ser una gran empresaria como mujer de negocio, cuenta que no descansara hasta lograr sus sueños que es tener una venta de ropa en el mercado de San Pedro Sacatepéquez, tener un local, con toda clase de camisas en color y diseño y llegar a ser unos grandes distribuidores de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Mayli Cecilia T.

She and her husband make shirts of various sizes and colors. They started out their own business two years ago and thanks be to God that she has had demand for the product and has seen a good level of sales. In order to meet client demand she needs more working capital, reason why she requests a loan. She has a 1-year old baby boy and she wishes to be a great businesswoman. She will not rest until she attains her dream of selling clothing in the market of San Pedro Sacatepequez. She wishes to have a stand with all kinds of shirts of various colors and designs and to become one of the great distributors of her village.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Cagay, Brgy. Buenavista, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish. Her husband, Danilo, age 44, works as a fisherman and also helps with his wife's business. They have seven children who are 4 to 21 years old. Leonora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Leonora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fishing vending business and for fishing materials so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Leonora L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a fishing boat

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María Nelis, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, ella vive con su esposo y su hija; este negocio lo atiende desde hace 7 años y trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella quiere invertir en el negocio y proporcionar a los clientes verdura y fruta fresca, de diferentes clases, más de las de temporada; solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión y lograr alcanzar un desarrollo y atender a un buen número de clientes, obteniendo de esta manera mejores ingresos.
Su proyección es tener un negocio amplio, estable que le genere los ingresos necesarios para cubrir con las necesidades cotidianas y ser un buen cliente en esta institución.
texts.en:
María Nelis lives in Usulután with her husband and daughter. She sells fruit and vegetables. She has worked in this business for 7 years and works with the support of her husband.

She wants to invest in her business and supply her customers with fresh fruit and vegetables of different and more seasonal types. She is applying for a loan to make this investment and reach this stage of development, where she will serve a good number of customers and in this way obtain a better income. Her plan is to have an extensive, stable business that generates the income necessary to cover the daily necessities and to be a good customer of this institution.

loans.use: Buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Copo de Nieve” inicia su ciclo número 22  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, es un grupo antiguo que ya se conoce.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, 7 mujeres y 1 varón.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de abarrotes, venta de CD – DVD, costura, artesanía, venta de cosméticos y venta de comida rápida en un micro Snack. 

La señora Lucila, presidenta de la banca comunal indica que forma parte del B.C. “Copo de Nieve” gracias a la invitación de una amiga hace nueve años. Casada, madre de cuatro hijos, su negocio es la venta de productos en general en una tienda ubicada en una zona comercial de la zona de El Alto, desde hace 20 años atrás. Ella comenta que este negocio fue producto de su propia iniciativa. El primer crédito fue por Bs. 2000.-, ahora ha solicitado Bs.6000.- para la mejora de su tienda. Las ventas son realizadas todos los días durante todo el día, para esta labor tiene la ayuda de sus hijas.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es la capacitación en salud; tambien comenta que la atención del consultorio le parece buena.
texts.en:
The “Copo de Nieve” (Snowflake) Communal Bank initiated its 22nd loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), reporting to the Santiago II Office.  “Snowflake” is a very old group that is well known.  The bank is composed of 8 members, 7 of whom are women. The businesses they run are varied: selling groceries, selling CDs and DVDs, dressmaking, artisan work, selling cosmetics, and fast food sales in a micro snack shop.

Lucila, president of the communal bank, says she joined the bank thanks to an invitation from a girl friend some 9 years ago.  Married, the mother of 4 children, her business sells general merchandise in a store located in a commercial zone of El Alto, starting some 20 years back.  Lucila comments that this business was a product of her own initiative.  

Her 1st loan was for 2,000 Bolivars.  Now, she is requesting 6,000 Bolivars, to improve her store.  Her sales occur every day during the entire day.  To carry out the work she has the help of her daughters.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she commented 'the health training'; also, she said that the attention received in the consulting office is good.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa; ella tiene 64 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, ella trae diferentes frutas de la ciudad de Quillabamba y los vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad del Cusco o diferentes distritos, la socia vende manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, uvas y duraznos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Siempre Unidos" (Always United). The bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province of Cusco and the Cusco department. 
The member is Maria, she is 64 years old and is a widow with 4 children. The member combines her household tasks with a business selling fruit. She brings various fruits from the city of Quillabamba and she sells them from a cart in the streets of Cusco or in other districts. She sells apples, bananas, oranges, grapes, and peaches. The member wants to grow her business selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits in bulk. 
The member is grateful to those who are helping her to realize this dream through this loan, and she promises to make her repayments according to the agreed timetable.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy fruits in bulk

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de lechón al horno, platillo que es muy delicioso y tiene mucha demanda. De esta manera, Milagros debe comprar cerdos, que son comprados para luego dedicarse a su alimentación hasta que tenga el peso exacto, ahí es cuando los sacrifica para ser cocinados y poder preparar este platillo. Una vez listo, es expendido en  las ferias comerciales, donde acude mucha gente ya que la cantidad que prepara le abastece para 100 personas. En ocasiones su cuñada y su suegra la ayudan en el negocio, así puede atender la cantidad de personas que acuden a su puesto de venta. Por tal motivo espera implementar su negocio. Es el crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, son  responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos y también mandará acondicionar un horno en el interior de su casa, porque el actual esta en el patio.
texts.en: Milagros is 32 years old; she lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. For 10 years she has been making oven-roasted pig, a dish that is very delicious and in high demand. Because of this, Milagros should buy some pigs, and once they are purchased, she will feed them the right diet until they are the exact right weight. This is when she will sacrifice them to be cooked so she can prepare this dish. Once the dish is ready, it is sold in the markets where many people go, so she prepares enough for 100 people. On occasion her sister-in-law and her mother-in-law help her with the business, and this is how she is able to serve all the people who stop by her booth. Because of this she wants to (better) set up her business. This is her 15th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support. Also, she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because all the members are people she knows, who are responsible and loyal. She is grateful to all the people who will be lenders on this loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for the progress of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy more pigs and also get an oven installed in her home, because right now it is on the patio.

loans.use: Buy more pigs and equip her home with an oven

loans.name: Corazon De Ayala Group

texts.es: La señors Sarahi M. es casada, tiene dos hijos y lleva 14 años dedicandose a ventas, en esta ocasión desea iniciar un negocio de renta de tablones y sillas para eventos y así poder tener más ingresos para solventar gastos de la educación de sus hijos teniendo este nuevo negocio. Cuenta con un buen historial crediticio aunque en credicomun está por cumplir un año sin embargo comenta que se siente muy a gusto con la institución, ya que se siente reconocida al recibir los incentivos por ser puntual tanto ella como el resto del grupo, espera seguir mucho tiempo con la empresa pues está conciente de que es una buena oportunidad para incrementar su negocio. La señora Reynalda C. es la señora de sudadera rosa que se ve en el extremo izquierdo de la foto, salio un poco cortada, pero sí se alcanza a ver su rostro.
texts.en:
Sarahi M. is married, has two children, and has dedicated herself to sales for 14 years.  She currently would like to start a business renting tables and chairs for events and in this way increase her income to pay for the educational expenses of her children.  She has a good credit history but has only been a member of CrediComun for less than a year.  She is well-liked by the institution and she, like the others in the group, has received incentives to be punctual in her payments.  She would like to be a long-term member of the group as she knows that it is a good resource to help her grow her business.

Reynalda C. is the woman in the pink sweatshirt that you can see in the extreme left of the photo.  She is slightly cut out of the photo, but you can see her face.

loans.use: To buy tables and seats to rent

loans.name: Hilda Veronica

texts.es:
Hilda, tiene 31 años D. edad, resiD. en Ereguayquin, Usulután, posee una panadería, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, D. 10 y 3 años D. edad, tiene casa propia, ella aprendió el proceso D. hacer pan desD. los 12 años D. edad, porque su madre también tiene panadería y le inculco desD. muy pequeña este oficio, desD. el año 2004 ella decidió instalar su propio negocio.
En la actualidad ella posee el negocio y el horno donD. se cocina el pan es D. barro y lo tiene ubicado en el patio D. su casa sin protección para lluvias por lo que ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para construirle una casita al horno para protegerlo D. las lluvias y D. cualquier causa D. daño al horno, con este préstamo estará comprando lamina y hierro para llevar a cabo la construcción.
El objetivo D. Hilda es mejorar el establecimiento del negocio para que tenga más vida útil el horno ya que D. él depenD. el comercio del pan y la alimentación D. los hijos.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 31, lives in Ereguayquin, Usulután.  She has a bakery.  She lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 3.  She has her own house.

She learned the process of making bread when she was 12 years old because her mother also has a bakery.  She was taught this traD. when she was very little.  In the year 2004 she decided to establish her own business.

She currently has the business.  The oven where she bakes the bread is maD. of clay.  It is located on the patio of her house.  It is not protected from the rains.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She wants to buy materials to build a structure to protect the oven from the rains and anything else that might damage it.  She will use the loan to buy tin and iron to carry out the construction.

Hilda’s objective is to improve her business establishment so that the oven has a longer, useful life.  Feeding her children is dependent upon her bread business.

loans.use: To buy tin and iron to build a roof for the oven she uses to bake bread

loans.name: William

texts.es: cliente tiene 24 años labora como chofer de omnibus y volvos , tanto de transporte de personal en su mayoria de veces pero tambien transporta carga pesada, segun referencias si labora esta firmando con el dueño de la empresa, es soltero sin carga familiar y vive en casa de sus padres, posee acumulacion de bienes que los ha adquirido al contado, no tiene endeudamiento y solicita credito para gastos personales.
texts.en: William is 24-years-old. He works as a driver, usually in personal transportation but he also sometimes transports heavy loads. According to references, if he works he's employed with the owner of the company. He's single and lives in his parents' house. He owns some goods that he paid for in cash. He has no debts and he's requesting this loan for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Geny

texts.es:
La Sra. Geny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín . Es soltera, tiene 44 años y no tiene hijos.
	
Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar y motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de Venta de Cosméticos, obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio, ya que en cada campaña ofrece sus productos de belleza a sus amistades. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde ofrece y recibe a sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa de alcanzar poco a poco sus metas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00, comprará  mas productos de belleza, para tenerlos en stock como: colonias, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes y cremas para damas y caballeros, lápiz labiales y para contornos de ojos , polvos compactos,  y otros productos  mas, todo esto para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Geny, se siente muy feliz del negocio que realiza y esta muy agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que brindan a mujeres que quieren salir adelante,  espera que sigan así siempre y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Geny is a member of the “Esmeralda” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province, in San Martín department.  She is single, 44 years old, and doesn't have any children.

Faced with the need to make income for her household and through her own motivation, Geny set up her small business selling cosmetics.  She has obtained very good results from her business from the beginning since, during each sales season, she offers her beauty products for sale to her friends.  Her business is located in her home, in a well-equipped space where she offers her products for sale and greets her customers.  She is currently continuing in the same business and is very proud that she is gradually achieving her goals.

Geny will use this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more beauty products to have in stock such as colognes, perfumes, talcum powders, deodorants, ladies' and men's creams, lip sticks, eye liners, powder compacts and other products.  She will buy all these products to keep her customers happy.

Geny feels very happy with her business and she is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support that they provide to women who want to get ahead in life.  She hopes that they continue doing this forever and that they help many families and enterprising women.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to increase her stock

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita C. is from the village of Quary, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Clarita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a business selling green bananas, corn grains & coconuts in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts & bananas to sell

location.town: Quary, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es: Alma Nidia tiene su negocio que es una farmacia, pues no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos para su negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable lo ha demostrado por el buen record crediticio que tiene. Inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos le solicitan diferentes medicamentos, ella siempre esta complaciéndoles y brindándoles un muy buena atención.  El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de una gran variedad de medicamentos, pues Alma los ofrece a aprecios accesibles.
texts.en:
Alma Nidia manages a pharmacy. This is not the first time she has requested a loan for her business. She is a person who has demonstrated that she is responsible through her good credit record. Alma started this business on her own since most of her neighbors are in need of different medicines. She is always friendly to them and provides them with good service.

The reason for this loan is to purchase a wide variety of medicines so that Alma can offer them at affordable prices.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase medicines

loans.name: Bethleem Plus Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the chairman of a Community bank named “Bethleem Plus”, composed of 10 microentrepreneurs united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Caleb earns a living by selling apples, a business he started in 2001 with US$30 as his starting capital. He also manages a small motorcycle transport business. Caleb is seeking a loan to reinforce his working capital through an increase in his business inventory. A 33-year-old married father of a two-year-old son, Caleb is happy that he is going to be able to increase his inventory with the loan. Currently, through his sales, Caleb makes about $270 per week.

A trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having seven times received and properly repaid loans, his dream is to someday open a transportation company in Kinshasa.

loans.use: to increase store inventory in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.name: Narianella

texts.es: Narianella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Narianella vive en la parte urbana del distrito. Gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores como ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Narianella es una mujer trabajadora. Les agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Narianella is 41 years old and single.  She lives in her own home in the Motupe district, an agricultural zone within the Lamayeque province, located an hour and a half from Chiclayo.  Narianella lives in the urban part of the district and makes her living raising and selling small livestock like sheep, goats, corral birds, and hogs.  When they reach a good point in their development, she sells them at the local market.  She wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced feed, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 PEN though Edpyme Alternativa.  Narianella is a hard working woman and is very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping her grow her business.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito S. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 60 years old. Paquito is married and has three adult children. Paquito owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paquito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Paquito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Paquito has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Paquito is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Paquito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles. sugar and coffee

loans.name: Lieu's Group

texts.en:
Lieu T. T. D. is 41 years old and has two children.  They live in Hoi Phu village. The income she earns from being a farmer is not enough to cover  her family's expenses. Therefore, she also makes bamboo brooms to sell, which supplements her daily income. She has been in this business for four years and earns 100,000 VND profit per day, which helps her improve her family's standard of living. Lieu is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy  bamboo to increase the quantity of brooms she makes. 

Hoa T. P. is 45 years old and has two children. She makes brooms to sell in the wholesale market. She is requesting a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy materials.

Thao T. P. is 43 years old and has two children. She runs a business that focuses on making bamboo brooms. She is requesting a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy bamboo.
 
Trang T. C. is 30 years old and has one child. She makes brooms to sell in the local market. She is requesting a loan of  5,014,000 VND to buy materials.

Lan T. C. is 47 years old and has one child. She is a rice farmer. In her free time, she makes brooms to earn extra income. She is requesting a loan of 5,104,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for brooms

loans.name: Chalita

texts.en:
Chalita is a married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Chalita is 50 years old.

Chalita has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Chalita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Chalita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Chalita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Juvelyn has a retail shop selling canned goods, noodles & biscuits. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Juvelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Juvelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & biscuits

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo es taxista en el municipio D. Sumpango Sac, doña Juana es tejedora y también se dedica a sembrar diferentes verduras en esta época ya que aquí en Guatemala en esta época es en donD. se aprovecha  a sembrar ya que esta es la época D. lluvia es por eso que solicita otro crédito para poder invertirlo en agricultura y tejidos ella promete ser puntual en los pagos. El Sueño D. ella es sacar adelante a sus hijos y así mismo ayudar a su esposo.
texts.en: Juana is the mother of three children. Her husband’s a taxi driver in Sumpango Sac.  Juana is a weaver and also grows various seasonal vegetables because here in Guatemala this is the planting season because it’s the time of the rains.  She is asking for another loan to invest in farming and in textiles.  She promises to be punctual with her payments.  Her dream is to move her children ahead and to help out her husband.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and textiles.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 19 years old and still single. She earns about 15,000 PHP per harvest as a rice farmer working in the Philippines. May has been growing rice for the past three years and is thankful that she is able to maintain her business.

Due to the expensive cost of farm supplies, May is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and insecticides. In the future, May hopes to expand her rice farming business and improve her income to save for the future. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el hospedaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar colchas, sabanas, y comprar una calefacción para implementar el hospedaje.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo."  This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which is in the Ururbamba province in the department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, lives with a partner, and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her guest house business. She works from 8am until 6pm, and through this business she is able to support her children.  She wants to better outfit her guest house, and so she requests a loan to buy bedspreads, bed sheets and a heater.  

She is pleased to be getting this loan, and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed sheets and a heater

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old, married, and has two children. With both children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them. 

Josephine runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy inventory like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, eggs, spices, noodles, etc. 

In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Shella Mae

texts.en:
Shella Mae is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.  Shella Mae has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & detergents.  Shella Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shella Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & detergents

loans.name: Jenny Margot

texts.es:
Jenny nació en la ciudad de Lima (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de libre unión de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Kimbiri y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella es profesora y trabaja en la zona de la selva. Ella tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de comida en la ciudad de Urubamba y está administrado por sus hermanos. Ya son vaR. años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Jenny es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas de azúcar, bolsas de arroz y otras cosas más.

Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Jenny was born in the city of Lima (Perú) and is 29 years old. She lives in a committed relationship by which she has two children. Currently she lives in the city of Kimbiri where she carries out her activities. She is a teacher and works in the rainforest region. She has a family business which consists of food sales in the city of Urubamba, managed by her siblings. It has been a number of years now that they have devoted themselves to this business and it is going very well for them. The loan Jenny requires is for buying bags of rice and sugar, and some additional items. 

The communal bank "Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba" meets every month in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cucsco is known for being a heavily touristed, business-oriented region, and for its traditional Inti Raymi festivities. One of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is there.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar and rice, and some additional items.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 49 years old and lives with her spouse, with whom she has five children. They live in their own house, located in the village of San Antonio province of Isabela. Angelita is a courageous woman who has decided to not be afraid of anything. She is ready to do anything to achieve her goals. Before she had this business, she worked in agriculture, cultivating corn and obtained a good income. 

Now she makes her living selling pigs which clearly is not so physically demanding as working in the fields. At present, her beloved husband is the one who cultivates the fields; on occasion, he also assists her. Angelita is pleased with the work that she is doing because it is also a good source of income. Sometimes she must wake up very early to distribute the food to her pigs.

Angelita wants to increase her capital in order to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luz Ofelia

texts.es:
Luz Ofelia en las afueras de su casa tiene un carrito para la venta de frituras, su comida se está siendo muy reconocida gracias a que es muy buena y de excelente calidad.

Ella con su negocio le permite tener el sustento diario para su familia, además de poder estar activa. Ella quiere tener un restaurante no solo para tener una excelente calidad de vida sino también para poderles dejar a sus hijos una entrada fija de dinero.
texts.en:
Luz Ofelia has a cart outside her house where she sells fritters. Her food is becoming well known because it is very good and of excellent quality. 

Her business allows her to support her family and stay active. She wants to have a restaurant not only to have an excellent quality of life, but to be able to give her children a steady income.

loans.use: to outfit her locale.

loans.name: Naroeun

texts.en:
Naroeun (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver, while her husband, Ra, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1996 and have one young daughter. They live in a village across Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Nareoun hopes to continue her weaving business, so she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: To buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia, 53, is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nonito, a salesman, and has three children. Together they manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eufemia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked meat for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Eufemia hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
