* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her store.

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en:
Suitupe is 43 years old and married with three children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a bakery and she sells baked goods in her local community. Suitupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this will be her fifth loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Suitupe is requesting a 2,500 WST loan to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her loan (estimated to be 800 WST or 333 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  To earn a living, he sells dried fish.  He has been in this business for almost two years.  He employs one person in the business.  

He has managed to boost his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya. George hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy dried fish.

loans.use: to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother). Eseza has a business of a food stall.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Eseza sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Eseza has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of bananas, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, and cabbages.  The main business challenges for Eseza include seasonality, transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and also to educate her children up to university. Eseza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se esta dedicando al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes,ella venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,lecche y fideos,ella tambien en el local D. su tienda D. abarrotes venD. desayunos en las mañanas y tambien venD. kekes en forma ambulatoria en las tardes,por medio D. estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes,negocio D. venta D. desayunos y negocio D. venta D. kekes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y fideos para implementar la tienda D. abarrotes y tambien comprar insumos para prepara los desayunos y kekes como harina,leche,azucar y mantequilla al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member who works in her small grocery store business. She sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk and pasta, In her grocery store she also sells breakfasts in the morning as well as cakes as a street vendor in the afternoon. With these small businesses she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve her grocery store business, and her breakfast and cake selling businesses. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and pasta to stock her store and also to buy ingredients to make the breakfasts and cakes, such as flour, sugar, and butter wholesale.  

Gloria is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and pasta to stock her small grocery store as well as to buy ingredients to prepare breakfasts and cakes, such as flour, milk, and butter wholesale.

loans.name: Honronya (Honnêteté) Group

texts.fr:
Honronya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les tissus et les ustensiles  de cuisine etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Awa est la vendeuse de tissus de ce groupe, elle est au bout à gauche. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des tissus en gros à un coup très abordable. Elle se procure des tissus au grand marché de Koutiala et à Bamako. Elle vend ses tissus en détail et au comptant au marché de  Hamdallaye à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Honronya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Awa compte réaliser 60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks de tissus ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Honronya is a group of women from Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 32 years old, are married, and have at least 3 children each.
This group of women sells various articles such as fabrics, kitchen utensils etc.
In order to increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme .This is their first group loan.
Awa is the fabric seller in this group, she is at the end on the left in the photo.
She intends to use her loan to purchase wholesale textiles at a reasonable price. She buys her textiles at the market in Koutiala and Bamako. She sells her fabric retail for cash at the market in Hamdallaye to a diverse and varied clientele.
Whereas the members of the Honronya group intend to make an average profit of 55 000FCFA each during the loan, Awa hopes to make 60 000FCFA.  
In addition to the repayment of the loans, they use part of the income to assume the daily family expenses.
They wish to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that the stock of textiles does not become scarce.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, age 41 years, is married to Nicholas and is blessed with three children. She runs a car hire business that has been in operation for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of about KES 15,500.

This is her second loan with KADET and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. She will use the funds to buy spare parts for the cars. 

Lucy hopes to own a fleet of cars for hire in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the cars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking woman  who earns a living through weaving native baskets and other decorative made of buri (palm). She is fifty-one year old married woman and has eight children , whom two are still attending school.Her husband's way of living is by being a welder.

 Basket making is in demand these season, that is why she join CEVI to avail loan to be able to improve her earnings.

Sheila  wants  to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twig) and nito and buli (are variety of palm). In that way, her production will improve and she could produce quality baskets, too.
 
She is determined that she will be striving hard to make her livelihood more progressive and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twig) and nito and buli (are variety of palm)

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Heladeria Nieves is a small Ice Cream Shop owned by Nieves A. (appropriately, Nieves means snow in Spanish). At her shop she also sells snacks and candies. She has a good amount of business because her ice cream shop is conveniently located by a school and a children’s park. Therefore most of her clients are kids and young adults. She started this business with only $30 about four years ago. She would like to take out this loan in order to buy ice cream at larger quantities and also to continue to invest in other products that may be attractive to her young clients. She also wants to finish paying off the last $100 she owes for the freezer she stores the ice cream in.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy ice cream, candy and snacks for her ice cream shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a printing press for his printing and design business

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta S. is married and has two children. She lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam. Bernadeta collects fresh fish from the Indian Ocean shores, spices and fries them, and sells the fish near her residence. She wants to make her  business attractive by improving sanitary conditions and purchasing other necessary supplies for her business premises. A display case and aluminum-foil wrapping materials would make her business more attractive to her customers. This will increase her sales and profit. Next year her first born will join secondary school. The increased income will enable her save for school fees. To implement her plan, she needs a loan of $550.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Mrs. M. has two children in primary school. She relies on her husband's salary, but she wants to augment it and has used her savings to start up a tamale business. She would use the loan to buy corn, sugar, firewood, and other raw materials used in the manufacture of her delicious tamales. She makes two kinds: plain tamales and tamales with various fillings; the latter are her best sellers.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. M. es madre de dos niños que están estudiando la primaria, aunque cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, ha invertido parte de sus ahorros en montar una empresa productora de tamales para incrementar los ingresos familiares, está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, azúcar, leña y otros materiales que le permitan elaborar sus "deliciosos" tamales, nos cuenta que elabora dos tipos de tamales, los simples y los rellenos, siendo estos últimos los más vendidos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tamales.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is 34 years old, married with 2 children. She has been with LAPO for 6 years and is seen by us as a leader. She sells provisions to her community.

Joy lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has 11 years' experience in her business. She needs a loan of US$ 325 to build up her business by purchasing more goods for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Mr. Emmanuel  E. a car paint dealer, and lives in Benin City with his four children and wife. He requests a   loan in the amount of $550 to buy more car paint to sell. He learned how to sell car paint for a year after which he started his own business in 2006. He is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more car paint to sell

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
H. is in this business since 2002. At one time she had 2 stalls, however one kiosk has to be closed. This was a direct effect of the Bali bombing, that resulted in reduced customers. The kiosk she still worked on today is in front of her house selling Grilled Fish and Chinese Food at Sidakarya street. Besides serving customers at the stall, H. also accept catering which is delivered directly to orderer's home. Daily income reach between Rp 200,000-500,000 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500). Besides a helper, her husband is also helping her. H. bought raw materials in Badung and Pemecutan markets. Mode of transportation to buy raw materials and deliver orders are by motor cycle. Loan to be obtained are expected to expand the business. H. is blessed with 3 children. Two is at school in Java island at an education cost of Rp500,000/month. The smallest one lives in Bali wit the parents at a daily cost of Rp50,000.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

H. menekuni usaha ini sejak tahun 2002. Dia sempat mengelola 2 warung, namun satu warung harus ditutup. Hal ini pengaruh dari bom Bali yang mengakibatkan pelanggan jadi menurun. Warung yang masih dia kelola sampai saat ini ada di depan rumahnya - warung Ikan Bakar dan Chinese food – di jalan Sidakarya. Di samping melayani pelanggan yang datang sendiri ke warung, H. juga melayani pesanan yang diantar langsung ke alamat pemesan. Dalam sehari pendapatannya berkisar antara Rp 200.000,00 – Rp 500.000,00. Selain satu orang tenaga kerja, suaminya juga ikut membantunya. H. membeli bahan bakunya di Pasar Badung dan atau di Pasar Pemecutan. Sarana transportasi pembelian bahan mentah maupun pengantaran pesanan dia menggunakan sepeda motor. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh diharapkan dapat membantunya untuk mengembangkan usaha. H. dikaruniai 3 orang anak. Dua orang anaknya sekolah di Jawa dengan biaya pendidikan Rp 500.000,00/bulan. Sedangkan yang paling kecil tinggal di Bali bersama orang tuanya dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 50.000,00.

loans.use:
To buy materials needed for stall

Membeli barang - barang kebutuhan warung

loans.name: Sarnah

texts.en: Sarnah is a 42-year-old woman. Before she joined MBK, her husband, A. was the only one who worked in the family. But since she joined MBK, she started her own bamboo matting business at her house. She usually earns about US$ 23 per month. She needs a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her bamboo matting business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
In my house I have a store where I sell Omnilife products. I have a long list of customers and now I would like to sell my products in some nearby towns. I would also like to sell to ranches but for this I need to invest in the purchase of more merchandise in order to offer my clients a greater variety of products. I am asking for a loan of $500 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Tengo en mi casa una venta D. productos Omnilife y ya tengo una lista granD. D. clientes, ahora me gustaría venderr mis productos en algunos puebL. que están cerca, también en rancherías pero para eso necesito invertir en la compra D. más mercancía y poder ofrecerles a mis clientes productos variados”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
K. Saboat is 37 years old, married and has three children of school age. She works as a vendor, selling children's clothing in her city's central market. K. does all of her own purchasing, which means that she spends lots of time traveling to nearby cities, looking for high-quality clothing at prices that middle-income people can afford.

K. is by nature warm and friendly, and tries to exhibit these characteristics in her work so that her customers have a positive experience and want to come back to her store. Her business is stable, which means that she can contribute considerably to the family budget. K. would like to increase the range of items she has to offer by buying more clothing to sell. To do this, she has requested a loan of $300, which she will repay in three months. K. has a positive credit history and promises on-time repayment.

loans.use: Expand the selection of children's clothing available to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise to better stock her store.

loans.name: Joecy

texts.en: Joecy M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 27 years old, and has one infant child but is not married.  In 2006, Joecy established her used clothing business, which imports second-hand clothes from North America and Europe, washes and irons them, then sells them in the street markets. She is assisted by her colleague. She now requires a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina Z. sells housewares and women's underwear. She is married, but her husband's income from taxi driving is not sufficient to support Marina and their five children.

Demand for her products is high and she is looking to expand her inventory to increase her profits. A loan will allow her to purchase more products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional housewares and other products for resale

loans.name: Ni Made Ekarini

texts.id:
Ni Made Ekarini is considered a young woman, but her persistence in work is considred as high. Since her husband's income as building laborer is just enough to pay for family and child expenses, Made Ekarini tried to raise pigs. With an initial loan from DINARI, Made Ekarini could buy 3 piglets that was raised for 3 months, then sold for Rp1,900,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), wit a nett profit of Rp 400,000. From that satisfactory result, Made Ekarini plans for the next loan from DINARI, that would be used to buy more piglets and feed. So that profit from this expanded pig business could be sufficient to pay for family needs, and also to add capital to a food stall that she would expand in her home as a side business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Ekarini tergolong ibu rumah tangga yang masih muda, tetapi keuletannya dalam bekerja patut diakui sangatlah besar. Karena penghasilan suaminya yang pas-pasan sebagai buruh bangunan, untuk menghidupi keluarga dan anaknya Made Ekarini berusaha memelihara babi. Dengan meminjam ke DINARI Made Ekarini bisa membeli 3 bibit babi yang dipelihara selama 3 bulan kemudian dijualnya seharga Rp. 1.900.000,- dengan keuntungan yang didapat sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Melihat hasil yang memuaskan ini, Made Ekarini melanjutkan dengan pinjaman berikutnya ke DINARI yang akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi lebih banyak lagi serta membeli pakannya. Sehingga keuntungan dari usaha babi yang dikembangkannya bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya disamping itu juga bisa menambah modal warung yang dikembangkannya juga di rumahnya sebagai pekerjaan sampingan.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakannya)

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
B. Abdugaffor is 54 years old. With his wife they have raised their daughter. Abdugaffor is a farmer. He is a strong physical and spiritual man. Each day he works diligently to make sure that he takes good care of his crop. Abdugaffor sows potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and tomatoes, which he then sells at the local market. Not one minute goes by that he is not attentive to his crop. He plows the land to the best of his abilities. 

Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 30 years and to offer them an education as well. With his job, he has been able to pay for the schooling of his dearest daughter and now he is planning to send her to Turkey for continuation of her education at the university. With this purpose today, Abdugaffor requests 3000 Somoni ($875) for the term of 10 months. He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Abdugaffor thanks everyone who trusted him and is supporting him today, and he promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan M. is a mother of two little kids and works with her husband growing various kinds of crops such as rice and vegetables. She and her husband can collectively make about 4.50 per day from selling their outputs to the brokers as well as to the people at a market. In order to make their farming work much better and do more faster, this couple would love to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a pair of cows.  They plan for the cows to help them by plowing their rice field and carrying heavy items for their farming activity. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Yan M. was not available).

loans.use: To purchase two cows to work on her rice field

loans.name: Duc

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Đức năm nay 38 tuổi. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Đến nay, ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá, cây cảnh. Hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Duc is 38 yrs old. In 1996 she joined the fund and borrowed her first loan to raise pigs. Presently, in addition to raising pigs, she also invested in a general store and selling plants. Her family's income is 345.00 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 1150.00 USD to invest and carry on her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim R., 39, is married with three children and works selling sugar cane juice around her town. She has a motor-bike attached to a cart that enables to travel around to sell her products. With her business activity, she can generate $5 per day of profit. 
Her husband is a farmer growing crops and vegetables. He can make around $2.50 per day by selling his crops to the people at a market.
Recently, she has asked for a loan from KIVA to buy a new motor-bike and buy more sugar cane to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane to expand her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu M. is 34 years old,  married and mother of three children, who are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop in Odumase, a suburb of Koforidua, Ghana where she lives with her family. Salamatu has been selling clothing materials, blouses and skirts, women slippers and clothing bags for the past eight years to support her family. She must, however, operate on a small scale due to lack of funds. 

This loan would increase her working capital and expand her business It would allow her to purchase a higher quality stock and upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing materials, ladies wear, headscarfs and slippers. Salamatu is a member of a borrowing group called God is good Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral, to access loans and provide support and assistance to one another with repayment.

loans.use: To purchase clothes; jeans, ladies wear and slippers

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Desde hace varios años se dedica, junto a su esposa, a la venta de ropa para todo tipo de público, desde bebes hasta adultos, recientemente, hace 3 meses, abrió otro stand o puesto de ropa, y le está yendo bien, y tiene planes de seguir extendiendo su negocio. Sus inicios fueron con poco capital, pero con el paso de los años fueron creciendo, lo que mantiene a Milton con muchas ganas de seguir esforzándose, porque sus hijas pequeñas lo mueven a seguir trabajando y para él es la mejor recompensa que puede tener. Es la primera vez que Milton solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Solicita este dinero con el que podrá invertir en la compra de polos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Milton is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and children. For several years now he has, along with his wife, dedicated himself to selling clothing for all types of people – from children to adults. Recently, three months ago, he opened another clothing stand and things are going well. He has plans to continue to expand his business. He started with little capital but, as the years passed, the business grew which gives Milton a great deal of enthusiasm to continue with his efforts. His small daughters motivate him to forge ahead with his work and, for him, it is the best reward he could get. This is the first time Milton requests a loan with MFP, for which he pledges to be punctual with his payments. He requests these funds to invest in the purchase of polos at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts at wholesale.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun A. is a group leader of six members who all live in Sre Sa village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Hun A. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a pump in order to water the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Keo Oeun, sells firewood. Mrs. Hun A. is 47 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. 

This is a group loan where four members have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a pump in order to water the rice field.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A., 40, is married and a mother of four. Two of her children are in senior high school, while two are in primary school. It has been Akua's dream to give her children a better education. 

Akua has been a food vendor for 15 years in the community market of Abofour, where she lives with her family. She sells rice with stew; her major customers are trader's. Her food is moderate and tastes good, attracting customers to her table.

Akua is applying for a loan to buy more bags of raw materials, such as rice, meat and charcoal. Increasing her stock would provide her with the resources to continue to provide cooked food and friend pastries even in as food prices continue to rise. She will use the proceeds from her work to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and raw materials

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en: Hezekiah O. is a 40-year-old married man with three children.  To support his family, he sells bags of dry corn to the people in his community; in turn, those individuals use the dry corn to prepare "pap", popularly known as "akamu" in Nigeria.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more bags of dry corn for resale purposes. He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional bags of corn

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana acaba D. cumplir 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, 6 D. ellos ya viven fuera, y una D. sus hijas y su nieta viven en su casa con ella. Más D. 40 años lleva en la labor agrícola, desD. entonces ha sembrado diversos productos como; papa, alverjas, maíz, hortalizas, y últimamente flores, el gladiolo.  Ahora no deja el cultivo D. este e último porque le ha resultado muy rentable desD. que hizo contactos con personas D. un mercado mayorista D. la capital, ya no espera los meses D. mayo y noviembre donD. tiene más demanda, sino que cada 15 días prepara los fardos D. flores que constan D. 12 docenas, a 20 soles, Feliciana lleva D. 20 a 25 paquetes por cada viaje, y una vez negociados, sus ganancias son muy buenas, acumulando a un monto D. 500 soles, incluido su capital D. trabajo. DesD. entonces siembra mayormente flores, sin abandonar sus otros cultivos, esperando que con el tiempo pueda comprarse un puesto en la cuidad. Feliciana es la tesorera D. su banco comunal, este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrados ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes, y para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. sus flores.
texts.en:
Feliciana just turned 57 years old. She is married and has 7 children. Six of her children live on their own and one of her daughters and her grandaughter live at home with her. She has been an agricultural laborer for more than 40 years. During this time she has grown various crops such as potatoes, peas, corn, vegetables and more currently Gladiolus flowers. She will continue to grow these flowers because it has been very profitable for her since she contracted with people in a wholesale market in the capital. She no longer has to wait for May and November when she has the most demand but rather every 15 days she prepares the bales of flowers which have 12 dozen and sell for 20 soles. Feliciana takes between 20 to 25 bales on each trip and, once negotiated, her earnings are very good. She accumulates an amount of 500 soles including her working capital. She has since mainly planted flowers without abandoning her other crops. She hopes that in time she will be able to purchase a stall in the city. Feliciana is the treasurer at her community bank. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has been shown to be very punctual with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers and to invest in her business in the sale of flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchaser fertilizers

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal V., 46, has been selected to be leader of this 4 member group from Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. V. is applying for a loan to purchase a secondhand motor for riding to work and for the family's needs. V. currently earns $2 per day preparing cloth for a company. She has two married children who are employed and live independently. Her husband is a building worker and he helps buy the family's food.

The other four borrowers are:
C. drives a motor taxi and he needs a loan to repair his old house.
S. is a tailor seeking a loan to buy sewing machines for her investment activities.
T. is a construction worker asking for a loan to buy a motor to ride to work.
M. is a local tailor and she is applying for a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motor for riding to work

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Renee es  casada tiene 49 años, cuatro hijos de 26,25,18 y él ultima de 15 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Renne se dedica a dar servicio de cosmetología corte de cabello, tinte, cepillado a domicilio, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo, y tiene su bazar-librería- perfumería. 
Renee necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de una secadora de cabello, cortadora de cabello para hombre, y una planchadora de cabello.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a tener cuidado con el dinero, a invertir en algo que él va a producir, que  pueda recuperar su  inversión. 
El sueño de Renee es tener un spac de belleza.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the community bank La Fortaleza. Renee is married, is 49 years old, has four children of 26, 25, 18 and 15 years of age, the youngest is attending the state school. Renee makes a living providing beauty services, hair cuts, color, combing, at the customers' homes. She also sell beauty products from catalogs and also has a shop-bookstore-perfume shop. Renee needs a loan of 800 soles to buy a hair dryer, hair clippers for men and a flat iron. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to take care of her money, to invest it in something that will generate income and be able to recover her investment. Renee dreams of having a beauty spa.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renee needs a loan of 800 soles to buy a hair dryer, hair clippers for men and a flat iron.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Andres A. vive en casa de sus padres, tiene una esposa que trabaja con tejidos y le ayuda en la manutención del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos en edad escolar,el Sr. Andres se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, el trabaja en el Radiotaxi Sureño, en la populosa zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2007, como cliente de credito individual, al momento se encuentra en su quinta secuencia, demostrando cumplimiento y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el credito realizara algunas reparaciones como ser: arreglo de motor y chaperia, pintura y desabollado.
texts.en:
Mr. Andres A. lives in his parents' home, has a wife that works in knitting and helps in the maintenance of the home. They have three school age children. He works at the Radiotaxi Sureño, in the busy area of the city of La Paz. Mr. Andres has been doing this for 10 years. He has been a client of Emprender since 2007 as a personal loan customer. He is currently in his fifth loan cycle, demonstrating compliance and responsibility in his repayments. He will use the loan to carry out some repairs to the vehicle motor and body, such as painting and dent removal.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair, mechanical and body work.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  esta casada con Darío Fariña, quien se desempeña como taxista, y ellos tienen 2 hijos. El negocio lo tiene en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caacupé y el servicio de la peluquería lo realiza con 5 peluqueras más.

Mercedes comenta que en la zona hay mucha competencia debido a eso ella desea modernizar al máximo su local y también por que trajo peluqueras de la competencia y estas traen consigo sus propia clientela.
Los préstamos otorgados por la Fundación Paraguaya lo invirtieron en la compra de muebles para su peluquería.

Comenta también que utiliza  todo tipo de estrategias para atraer nuevos clientes, resalta que en todas las temporadas del año ella lanza promociones, para así atraer más  clientes.

Mercedes y  Darío manifiestan su agradecimiento por el apoyo constante que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya para el fortalecimiento de su microempresa, y a la vez espera contar siempre con la ayuda recibida de la institución.
texts.en:
Mercedes is married to Dario Farina and they have two children. Dario works as a taxi driver. Her salon is located in the center of the city of Caacupe, where there are 5 other beauty salons. Mercedes notes that there is a lot of competition in the area, which is why she wants to modernize her salon as much as possible to attract new clients as well as continue with her regular clients. She uses various strategies to attract new business, including promotions she launches every season. She has invested the loans she has received in furniture for the salon.

Mercedes and Dario are grateful for the ongoing support that Fundacion Paraguaya provides for their small business, and they hope to continue receiving help from the institution.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: María Reinalda

texts.es: María Reinalda E. reside en Ciudad Delgado junto a su esposo, un nieto y su yerno. Ella posee una venta de granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles y azúcar; así también comercializa otro tipo de productos perecederos y jabón para la ropa. María posee su negocio en el mercado de Ciudad Delgado desde ya hace muchos años, y solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar al mayoreo todos sus productos, debido a que percibe muy buenas ventas, desea aumentar sus productos para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Reinalda E. lives in Ciudad Delgado with her husband, a grandson, and her son-in-law. She sells basic grains like rice, beans, and sugar. She also sells other kinds of perishable products and clothing detergent. María's business has been located in the market in Ciudad Delgado for many years. She is requesting a loan because she wants to be able to buy her products wholesale. Since she thinks she can make good sales, she hopes to increase her merchandise to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products wholesale

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
K. Mahina was born in 1987 in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. She is married. Mahina is engaged in commercial service and trade. Mahina has been selling women’s shoes in the local bazaar for 3 years. She works straight with suppliers and trades in lower prices than the regular bazaar prices. Her husband works in the Russian Federation and he sends money for her every month. Mahina also goes to Kukanda herself to purchase goods for her business. Mahina could improve her business significantly. Thanks to the previous loans from MicroInvest, today she has a good trade outlet that brings a good business turnover. Mahina thanks KIVA for its support.  She applies to KIVA for the business development loan of 3000 TJS (Tajikistan Sonomi) to use for the importing seasonal goods.   
   
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following steps of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees a transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore, in October of 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization known as “Arvand”.
“Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and to create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To import seasonal goods.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito de Collique (al norte de la ciudad de Lima) desde hace 12 años, con su pareja María de 46 años, la cual es comerciante, y con su hijo Junior de 11 años. Desde hace casi la misma edad de su hijo se dedica al oficio de electricista, siendo la actividad que aprendió desde muy joven para poder mantenerse, y la cual el día de hoy, se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. José trabaja bajo contratos, lo llaman para solucionar diferentes problemas que se presentan por avería de las instalaciones de electricidad en hogares particulares o instituciones. A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es independiente y lo realiza por horas, pero también es muy riesgoso, ya que más de una vez ha recibido alguna descarga de energía por no contar con las herramientas necesarias, a pesar de las precauciones que él toma. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante y juntos implementaron recientemente un pequeño restaurante, tratando de incursionar así en otros negocios para mejorar el futuro de su familia. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy puntual en los pagos de con su banco comunal, llamado “Estrella Azul”. Con el dinero solicitado comprará algunas herramientas para facilitar su oficio de electricista y también adquirirá lo necesario para seguir equipando su pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
José is 56, and he has lived in the Collique district (to the north of the city of Lima) for 12 years. He lives with his wife, María. She is a 46 year old merchant. They live with their 11 year old son, Junior. Ever since he was almost the same age as his son, he has worked as an electrician. He learned to do this when he was very young in order to support himself. This trade has now become his primary source of income. José works under contracts. They call him to fix different problems when something electrical does not work in certain houses or institutions. He really likes his work; he is independent and the jobs take hours. But, it is also risky. He has received electric shocks more than once, in spite of the precautions he takes, because he did not have the necessary tools. His wife is a merchant, and together they recently started a small restaurant. They are trying to venture into other businesses to improve their family’s future. This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he has always been very punctual in his payments with his Community Bank, Estrella Azul. He will use the money he is asking for to buy tools to facilitate his work as an electrician. He will also get necessary items to keep equipping his small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and set up his restaurant

loans.name: Jilna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jilna J. of Brgy. Lopez Jaena, Sagay City, Negros Occidental is a strong, 50-year old woman who is unwavering in her mission to fight poverty and improve the lives of her family. With her husband and three children, she works hard to make life better for everyone. 

Mrs. J. owns and manages a business that has grown over the last five years to become a combination of a   "sari-sari" (General) store, a "cafeteria" (coffee and snack shop) and a "carinderia" (eatery or small luncheonette). She has done well for herself and now earns approximately Php 15,000 per month, which is a big help to the family's finances.

Jilna is now borrowing PHP 19,000 to add to her revolving working capital for her slowly but surely expanding business. She hopes that her tireless work plus a little help from the loan will take her a few steps nearer to the achievement of her dream: financial security for her family. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for the sari-sari store, cafeteria and carinderia

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. is from the village of Tinotungan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old. Lilia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a hair dryer, hair extensions and other beauty products

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère d’un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de bijoux dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa part financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle gère bien son commerce, ce qui lui permet d’avoir l’estime et le respect de son mari. Elle s’approvisionne au Bénin où elle achète des perles et bijoux de qualité, qu’elle revend à Lomé. Les femmes des services publics et privés viennent faire des commandes de bijoux chez elle. Elle sait bien accueillir sa clientèle. Elle veut acheter de nouveaux bijoux en ce moment ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des montres bracelets pour dames et hommes, des colliers en or sur commande ainsi que d’autres articles de qualité.
texts.en:
This lady is married and has one child. She runs an income-generating business selling jewelry at the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé. This business allows her to contribute financially to the running of her household. She manages her business well, which earns her the respect of her husband. She supplies herself in Benin, where she buys pearls and high-quality jewelry, and then re-sells these items in Lomé. Women in both the private and public sectors come to order jewelry from her. She knows how to accommodate her customers. Currently, she wants to buy new jewelry; it is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy ladies' and men's wristwatches and custom-made gold necklaces, as well as other high-quality items.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell jewelry

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth T. is from Pagadian City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lilibeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Lilibeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37 years old Selina L. from Mbozi. She is married   with 2  children, between the ages of 8  and 12. Selina has been running a fish  business since 2004. She owns and operates a small stall from which she sells roasted fish. She buys fresh fish daily from local fishermen as they come in with their morning catch, and then roasts and sells these fish either in the fish market on along the roads of the city. Given its location along the water, fish is plentiful in the waters around the city and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet.  She is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur who is taking advantage of a local need to make monthly profits of $90.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase fish in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Selina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta A. is from the village of Bayabo East. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cristeta owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cristeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 62, sells groceries.  She has been in this business for 10 years. She is married with seven children. 

Mary is a very had working woman. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to expand her business by purchasing more groceries to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden R. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy more fresh vegetables, fruits and dried fish to sell. Kiden is 30 years old and is divorced. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a boutique. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more fresh vegetables, fruits, and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.en:
Leopolda S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married, with one school-aged child.  To make a living,  Leopolda owns and operates a pedicab transport (sikad-sikad) business.  She has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Leopolda joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 10000 PHP, to repair her existing vehicle for better service.  Leopolda plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is located in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her pedicab

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rent a workshop, buy sewing machines

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos sentimientos, tiene 38 años y está casada con Wilmer de 40 años. Esta pareja tiene dos hijos: David de 20 y Javier de 17 años, todos viven en su casa propia.

Desde hace 20 años, además de ser una excelente agricultora es una muy buena comerciante. Por las mañanas vende productos agrícolas oriundos de la sierra en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad y luego de las 10 de la mañana asiste a su esposo en sus chachas, pues ambos laboran juntos, tanto en el campo como en el hogar. Los productos que cultivan son el maíz, la papa, arveja y diferentes verduras muy demandadas en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta  a Leonor es recomendar a sus clientes qué puede cocinar con sus productos, por otro lado lo que le incomoda es encontrarse con algunas personas aprovechadas en el mercado.
Ella se muestra muy contenta con lo que hace, por lo que en el futuro desea ampliar su puesto con mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues sus ventas se han incrementaron debido a la buena atención que brinda.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra satisfecha con el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, ya que refiere que aprende de las experiencias de sus compañeros. En busca de una cosecha exitosa, con el dinero que ahora solicita, pretende comprar varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes; a su vez también invertirá en su puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Leonor is a nice person, is 38 years old, and is married to Wilmer (40). This couple has two sons: David (20) and Javier (17), and they all live in their own home. For the last 20 years, on top of being an excellent farmer, Leonor has been a very capable business woman. In the mornings she sells products from the sierra at the stall she has at a market in the city. After 10 a.m., she helps her husband with his house chores, since they work together both in the fields and in the home. They plant corn, potatoes, peas, and several vegetables that are in high demand in the market. What Leonor likes best is suggesting to her clients what to cook with the produce they buy. On the other hand, she doesn't like people at the market who take advantage of others. Leonor seems happy with what she does, but in the future would like to expand her business by offering more products, especially since her sales have gone up thanks to the great customer service she provides. This is the fifth loan Leonor requests from Kiva partner MFP. She is happy with her communal bank, where she tells us she learns from her fellow members' experiences. In hopes of a successful harvest, she will use the loan proceeds to buy several bags of fertilizer, and to invest in her little stall at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Marleny De La Cruz

texts.es: Marleny De La Cruz M. F. de 32 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.  Marleny posee una panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan, junto a su esposo quien es su mano derecha en el negocio, trabajan arduamente día con día para lograr entregar todos los pedidos a tiempo, responsabilidad la cual les ha permitido contar con una gran cantidad de clientes. Desde hace 4 años que Marleny posee esta panadería en la cual poco a poco se han ido ganando la confianza de sus clientes, y que a pesar de ser poco tiempo posee muy buenas referencias ya que su pan tiene muy buen sabor y es de muy buena calidad. Marleny solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para comprar harina, manteca, azúcar, miel y otros utensilios lo cuales se utilizan para hornear el pan, así mismo desea poder comprar la harina por mayor, ya que en la actualidad ha subido de precio, y comprándola en grandes cantidades, logra obtenerla más barata. Marleny desea mucho prosperar junto a su esposo en el negocio, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan, es por ello de mucha importancia mantenerla a flote y poder invertir lo más posible en ella para que genere mayores ingresos para beneficio de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny De La Cruz M. F., 32, lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband and her two dependent children who go to school. Marleny owns a bakery and is responsible for making bread. Her husband is her right-hand man at the business and they work hard everyday to ensure that all their orders are delivered on time. Their responsible nature has resulted in a strong client base. Marleny has owned this business for 4 years and slowly but surely she has earned the trust of her customers. Despite only being open for a few years, she has many good references and her bread is known for its good flavor and high quality.

Marleny is asking for a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) so she can have the money necessary to buy flour, butter, sugar, honey and other materials for baking bread. She wants to buy flour in bulk because flour prices have gone up and buying in larger quantities allows her to get a cheaper price. Marleny wants to find success with her husband with their business as it is their only source of income. Therefore it is very important for it to stay afloat and for them to be able to invest as much as possible in it so that they can increase their earnings which benefit their entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making bread

loans.name: Bayardo Jose

texts.es: Bayardo Jose de 25 años de edad es casado con la joven Rosa Pierina Marin con quien tiene una niña de 4 añitos estudiando el pre-escolar. Bayardo trabaja en sociedad en una tienda desde hace 6 años, en donde vende ropa de bebé, zapatos, blusas y otros articulos que buscan sus clientes.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su inventario, comprando articulos que se venden en esta epoca de verano, como es shorts, camisetas, sandalias, etc.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder seguir con su negocio, pues con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido poco a poco reinvertir en su negocio y brindarle el sustento diario a su familia.  Ademas desea poder terminar la universidad, ya que actualmente esta estudiando Lic. en Administracion de Empresas.
texts.en:
Bayardo Jose is 25 years old. He is married to Rosa Pierina Marin, with whom he has a 4 year old daughter who is in pre-school. Bayardo has worked in his store for the past 6 years, where he sells baby clothing, shoes, shirts, and other goods his clients need. He is asking for his 2nd loan in order to increase his inventory, and purchase the goods he sells during summer time, such as shorts, t-shirts, and sandals. Bayardo's dream is to continue expanding his shop, through which he is able to continue investing in his business and improve his family's quality of life. Furthermore, he would like to finish his university studies, where he is currently studying Business Administration.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Friends United Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs named their group “Friends United”. They are small-scale businesswomen from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 500,000 leones each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can improve their businesses, make more sales and consequently improving their standard of living. 

Kadiatu K., who is the leader of this group, is 29 years old. She was born in Magburaka town. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a professional worker and her children are attending primary school. For four years now, Kadiatu has been selling items such as toothpaste, sugar, pens, pencils, etc. With this loan, she will buy these items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, sugar, pens, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is married with three children and her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she stays with seven people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Milly takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include rent for her residence, medication, school fees and feeding the family.  She makes sweaters, tablecloths, cardigans and other items and sells to all categories of people at retail. She works seven days a week.  Milly works from her home and also does some tailoring work upon request. Milly receives at least five customers a day. She has been in this business for five years and her business challenge is transportation.  She has been with MCDT for a few years, servicing her third loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more threads and needles for making sweaters. Her main customers are schools and neighboring families. She aspires to open a shop in Kampala to get more customers in town. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving money to enterprising women.

loans.use: To buy more threads and needles

loans.name: Sangali

texts.ru: Тохиров Сангали проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын в России на заработках. Сам Сангали имеет высшее образование по специальности "Инженер". По профессии работал 5 лет. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области более 30 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Sangali T. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 69 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works in Russia. Sangali has high education and his major is an engineer. He has worked professionally for five years. Right now he works as a taxi driver and has been in this field for more than thirty years. He is asking for a loan to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 23 year old single man from Lebanon.  Since 2007, he has been working in the construction industry. He specializes in installing and repairing tiles, as well as polishing them. This type of business is very common in Lebanon. Ibrahim is known for his good work and is proud of his experience. He is able to serve several clients at the same time.  His clients can be anyone from his region and its surroundings. His challenge is the competition since it is a demanding work. When he first started, Ibrahim had difficulty making himself known to the public, but through his determination and hard work, he was able to build a network of clients. Ibrahim is requesting from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, a loan to purchase a new tile polishing machine. He hopes to continue to grow and enhance his business in the coming year. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Khamisa

texts.en:
Khamisa O. is currently in the business of selling bags of rice, maize, beans and groundnuts and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour to sell.  She is 52 years old and married to a businessman. She has eight children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy high-quality clothing for men and women and men's dress shoes

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El  señor Luis tiene 49 años y esta casado con la señora Basilica Martinez de 44. Ambos tiene 2 hijos que aun viven con ellos y están estudiando.
    El cliente  emprendió su pequeña microempresa hace un poco más de 4 años, pero desde hace mucho tiempo es comerciante, ya que se dedica también a la venta de mercaderías en forma ambulante. Es ayudado muy de cerca por su cónyuge.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como pantalones, camisas, remeras ya que en esta época estan de oferta. 
Más adelante desea ampliar el negocio con venta de artículos de bazar mercería.
   EL cliente  espera un futuro mejor para nuestro país con mucho trabajo y progreso .
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old and married to Basilica who is 44. In addition, they have 2 children who still live with them and are studying. A little over 4 years ago, he started his micro-enterprise, but he has been a merchant for a long time, selling merchandise on foot. He is closely assisted by his wife. Luis requests a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, and t-shirts that are presently available. Later, he wants to expand the business to include dry-goods articles. Luis hopes for a better future for his country, with a great deal of work and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PANTS AND SHIRTS TO SELL

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos, y de sus 8 jóvenes hermanos, juntos habitan en un paraje de la sierra peruana y trabajan para salir adelante. Desde muy joven estudio mecánica, y aprendió en los diferentes trabajos donde se desempeñaba, observaba como trabajaban los mecánicos experimentados, y así adquirió experiencia. Este joven trabajador tiene su taller propio, donde labora a lado de un ayudante, y repara todo tipo de autos, pues su habilidad le ha permitido obtener gran cantidad de clientes, que siempre lo buscan por la calidad del servicio. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y como si fuera poco, también se dedica a la agricultura, pues siembra en compañía de sus hermanos, papa y arveja, que durante el tiempo de la cosecha venden a los mayoristas de la ciudad, y luego se reparten las regulares ganancias que obtienen. Aunque trabaja de lunes a viernes en su taller, no descansa los fines de semana, pues se dirige a las chacras de su familia a cuidar sus cultivos. Siendo un joven emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su taller, renovar las herramientas y contratar un ayudante más, ya que quiere ofrecer mayor variedad del servicio automotriz. 





Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.  
Luis tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una maquina compresora para implementar mejor su taller de mecánica, y así espera mejorar el servicio que brinda.
texts.en:
Luis, age 24, lives with his parents and his eight young siblings in his parent’s house. They live together in a place on the Peruvian mountain range, and they work to get ahead. When he was very young he studied mechanics, and he learned the different jobs that are done. He observed how the experienced mechanics worked, and that is how he got experience. This hard-working young man has his own shop. He works with an assistant, and he repairs all types of automobiles. His ability has allowed him to have a lot of customers who always seek him out because of the quality of his service. He really likes his work. If that weren’t enough, he also works in agriculture. He and his siblings plant potatoes and peas. At harvest time they sell to the wholesalers in the city. Then they share the steady income that they get. Even though he works in his shop from Monday through Friday, he does not rest on the week-ends. He goes to his family’s fields to take care of the crops. As a young entrepreneur, he plans to improve the facilities of his shop, to repair his tools, and hire another helper. He wants to provide a greater variety of automotive service. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He pledges to make his payments on time. He is very grateful to the people who made this loan possible. It will allow him to continue working in the pursuit of progress. Luis plans to use the requested loan to buy a compressor in order to better outfit his mechanic shop. That way he hopes to improve the service that he offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate his shop's facilities and buy new tools

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona tiene 49 años, su actividad es una pulpería que inicio hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por su esposo cuando se caso con él pues necesitaba un medio de ingreso para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ella es muy famosa pues brinda una excelente atención a sus clientes y ha demostrad ser una mujer muy capaz y luchadora. Este financiamiento será destinado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella siempre está soñando con incrementar su inventario y transformar su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Petrona, age 49, has a grocery store. She started this business over five years ago. It started because of her husband. When she married him she needed a way to get income in order to improve the family’s living conditions. She is very well known because of the excellent attention she gives her customers. She has shown herself to be a very capable and tenacious woman. This loan is to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, juice, detergent, and basic grains. She is always dreaming of increasing her inventory and transforming her store into a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna Y. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Myrna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 1999, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Iris Yanet

texts.es:
Iris es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce frutas como el limón, mango y maracuyá. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. Ella suele ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, tratando de que sean de buena calidad y ofreciéndolos con un trato amable. Gracias a su esfuerzo diario su negocio cuenta con buena acogida por parte de sus clientes.

Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar. Iris anhela valerse de esta actividad para seguir progresando junto a su familia. Siguiendo este objetivo ha creído conveniente ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que su establecimiento se encuentre mas surtido y pueda ampliar sus ventas para percibir un mayor número de ganancias, por ello está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Iris es una mujer entregada a su familia y que es bastante estimada por sus vecinos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de realizar sus pagos.
texts.en:
Iris is a 32 year old mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural area, which produces fruits like lemons, mangos, and passion fruit.  The area is in the Lambayeque province, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs products and groceries in a store that is set up in a space in her home.  She sells diverse products for daily consumption to her customers.  She tries to have good quality products and to treat her customers nicely.  Thanks to her daily effort, her business is well received by her customers.

She uses the income that she gets from this activity to help her husband support the family.  Iris is eager to make use of this activity to continue progressing together with her family.  

Looking towards this objective, she believes it is advisable to expand her business by purchasing more products.  This is so that her store will be better stocked, and so that her sales will increase and give her more income.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 soles.

Iris is a woman who is devoted to her family, and her neighbors think highly of her.  She has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa before, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility about making her payments.

loans.use: To buy basic needs products and groceries to expand the store that is set up in her home

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.en:
Maria Lorenza is 44 years old and lives in the area of Ybate around the town of Ita. She has two sons and a 22-year-old daughter with a little baby and another son still attending school. 

For 15 years Maria Lorenza has been making honey bread, cakes and homemade sweets. She has a store in Ita where she sells her products and has a good number of regular customers; most are street vendors who are satisfied with the prices and products. 

Maria Lorenza thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the loan and the trust bestowed upon her and her business and will work hard to make her payments on time so that she can have larger loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, and baking powder

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 49 años, es conviviente y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Marcelina es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo aretes, ella exporta sus productos al país de Brasil. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Marcelina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para comprar materiales como platería. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and in a common law marriage. She participates as a member of the Communal Bank “Señor De Los Temblores II”, which is a microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Marcelina is an enterprising and hardworking mother who sells handcrafted items, such as earrings. She exports her products to the country of Brazil.

(The city of Cusco is located near one of the Eight Wonders of the World, the city of the Incas known as Machu Picchu.)

Marcelina hopes to receive her next loan in the amount of 2000 PEN. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials, such as silver.

Marcelina is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase materials, such as silver

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El señor Cirilo vive en casa propia, en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos todos casados e independientes; Cirilo trabaja en la Alcaldía de Cota huma en el área de electricidad. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar productos de primera necesidad, como azúcar, arroz, harina, etc., ya que en la casa tiene instalada una tienda de abarrotes la cual atiende su esposa para aumentar los ingresos de su hogar.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Cirilo lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children, who are all married and independent.  Cirilo works as an electrician at the Cota Huma town hall.  He is asking for a loan to increase his capital and to buy staple products such as sugar, rice, flour, etc., since his wife runs a grocery store out of their home to increase the family's earnings.  

He is a client of Impro, he is very good with payments, and his social character qualifies him to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, etc., for his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy welding supplies.

loans.name: Barsilisa

texts.es:
Barsilisa es una Sra. joven, viuda vive sola en el barrio remancito, no tiene hijos.
         Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas en su casa, además a la mañana trabaja en el poder judicial para aumentar sus ingresos.
       Ella compra las ropas de Argentina y el Brasil viajando semanalmente a esos destinos. 
          Ella se inicio con  un dinero que junto con otros trabajos anteriores, mes a mes va aumentando su negocio con el salario que recibe en el otro trabajo.
              Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
